context: "Ühes" is the Estonian partitive case form of "üks", which means "one". In Estonian, this word typically appears with the preposition "ühes" meaning "in one" or "in a single" when referring to location within singular nouns, or it can mean "together" when used without a specific prepositional context. It is commonly used in expressions indicating something happening in one place among multiple options, or involving people doing something together.
